medical_history.chief_complaint: Paralysis of all four limbs and respiratory muscles.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In December 2008, cough, purulent rhinorrhea, mild dyspnea, malaise, and low-grade fever developed. Symptoms resolved after 4 days. Two days later, cramping in the left calf progressed over 5 days to leg weakness, leading to hospitalization. By hospital day 2, weakness progressed to upper extremities. The patient became constipated and remained afebrile.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Common variable immunodeficiency diagnosed in 1991, chronic lymphoid interstitial pneumonitis, liver cirrhosis with esophageal varices, and spruelike enteropathy with chronic diarrhea. Spleen removal due to portal hypertension in 2006.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has two children who received childhood vaccinations, with one child receiving the oral poliovirus vaccine.
medical_history.social_history: Patient traveled to southern Florida with family 2 months prior to symptom onset.
